li.a: Treasure Valley Math and Science Center

div.h2: Educating Today for a Better Tomorrow!

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

a.title: What's Happening in Boise School District
a.span: What's Happening in Boise School District

a.title: Research, Grant and Proposal Review Procedure
a.span: Research, Grant and Proposal Review Procedure

a.title: New Hire Information for Certified Staff
a.span: New Hire Information for Certified Staff

li.a: What's Happening in Boise School District
Research, Grant and Proposal Review Procedure
New Hire Information for Certified Staff

div.p: In response to coronavirus (COVID-19), the Idaho State Board of Education voted to extend the current soft closure of all Idaho K-12 public schools and charters through the end of local schools’ academic year. On April 9, 2020, to provide students, parents and staff with clarity and certainty, Boise School District Trustees approved extending the current soft closure through May 22nd, 2020, the end of the 2019-2020 academic school year. Emergency remote Learning & Essential Services are currently being provided, as are Grab-and-Go Essential Meal Services for children who need nutritious meals while schools are closed. In addition, Boise School District is partnering with the Boys & Girls Club to provide emergency childcare amid the COVID-19 crisis. Please visit our COVID-19 Response webpage for more information and the latest developments.

div.h3: Summer School Online Registration Now Open04/20/2020

img.p: Online registration for Boise School District's 2020 Summer School program is now open.

div.h3: Boise School District Adds Suppers and Fresh Fruit & Vegetable Snacks at Select Meal Sites04/16/2020

img.p: In response to the current COVID-19 school closure, Boise School District will add suppers at most school meal sites beginning on Monday, April 27, 2020 and a fresh fruit or vegetable snack beginning Tuesday, April 21st for children who need nutritious meals while schools are closed.

div.h3: Partnering with Boys & Girls Club to Provide Emergency Child Care Amid COVID-19 Crisis04/02/2020

img.p: The Boys & Girls Clubs of Ada County, in collaboration with the Boise School District, will open two additional “pop up” Club sites to provide additional emergency child care relief amid the COVID-19 crisis.

div.h3: An Important Video Message from Superintendent 04/02/2020

img.p: Boise School District Superintendent of Schools Mr. Coby Dennis has an important message for our students, parents, staff and community during this challenging time.

div.h3: 2020 Census: Easy, Safe & Important To Our Schools 04/01/2020

img.p: Did you know? Completing the U.S. 2020 Census is critical to supporting our students and programs.

div.h3: Student Selection Process for TVMSC Revised04/01/2020

img.p: Due to the current school closure, the Treasure Valley Math & Science Center's student selection process for the 2020-2021 school year is being revised.

div.h3: We're Here for You: Emergency Remote Learning & Support for Essential Services03/30/2020

img.p: During the current COVID-19 school closure, Boise School District is here for our community. Our teachers and staff have created resources to support stay-at-home learning and essential services.
When it comes to the novel coronavirus (COVID-19), we want to reassure you that the Boise School District has a plan in place to keep our students and staff as safe as possible.

div.h2: Educating Today for a Better Tomorrow!

div.p: Boise School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to all individuals. Learn more...
